member.summary: Gets the PdfTableAttributes instance in "/A". If not existing, it creates one.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be StructElem for a structure element.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.S
member.summary: (Required) The structure type, a name object identifying the nature of the structure element and its role within the document, such as a chapter, paragraph, or footnote. Names of structure types must conform to the guidelines described in Appendix E.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.P
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The structure element that is the immediate parent of this one in the structure hierarchy.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional) The element identifier, a byte string designating this structure element. The string must be unique among all elements in the document’s structure hierarchy. The IDTree entry in the structure tree root defines the correspondence between element identifiers and the structure elements they denote.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.Pg
member.summary: (Optional; must be an indirect reference) A page object representing a page on which some or all of the content items designated by the K entry are rendered.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.K
member.summary: (Optional) The children of this structure element. The value of this entry may be one of the following objects or an array consisting of one or more of the following objects: • A structure element dictionary denoting another structure element • An integer marked-content identifier denoting a marked-content sequence • A marked-content reference dictionary denoting a marked-content sequence • An object reference dictionary denoting a PDF object Each of these objects other than the first (structure element dictionary) is considered to be a content item. Note: If the value of K is a dictionary containing no Type entry, it is assumed to be a structure element dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.A
member.summary: (Optional) A single attribute object or array of attribute objects associated with this structure element. Each attribute object is either a dictionary or a stream. If the value of this entry is an array, each attribute object in the array may be followed by an integer representing its revision number.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.C
member.summary: (Optional) An attribute class name or array of class names associated with this structure element. If the value of this entry is an array, each class name in the array may be followed by an integer representing its revision number. Note: If both the A and C entries are present and a given attribute is specified by both, the one specified by the A entry takes precedence.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.T
member.summary: (Optional) The title of the structure element, a text string representing it in human-readable form. The title should characterize the specific structure element, such as Chapter 1, rather than merely a generic element type, such as Chapter.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.Lang
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A language identifier specifying the natural language for all text in the structure element except where overridden by language specifications for nested structure elements or marked content. If this entry is absent, the language (if any) specified in the document catalog applies.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.Alt
member.summary: (Optional) An alternate description of the structure element and its children in human-readable form, which is useful when extracting the document’s contents in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.E
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) The expanded form of an abbreviation.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureElement.Keys.ActualText
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) Text that is an exact replacement for the structure element and its children. This replacement text (which should apply to as small a piece of content as possible) is useful when extracting the document’s contents in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot
member.summary: Represents the root of a structure tree.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.#ctor(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The document that owns this object.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be StructTreeRoot for a structure tree root.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys.K
member.summary: (Optional) The immediate child or children of the structure tree root in the structure hierarchy. The value may be either a dictionary representing a single structure element or an array of such dictionaries.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys.IDTree
member.summary: (Required if any structure elements have element identifiers) A name tree that maps element identifiers to the structure elements they denote.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys.ParentTree
member.summary: (Required if any structure element contains content items) A number tree used in finding the structure elements to which content items belong. Each integer key in the number tree corresponds to a single page of the document or to an individual object (such as an annotation or an XObject) that is a content item in its own right. The integer key is given as the value of the StructParent or StructParents entry in that object. The form of the associated value depends on the nature of the object: • For an object that is a content item in its own right, the value is an indirect reference to the object’s parent element (the structure element that contains it as a content item). • For a page object or content stream containing marked-content sequences that are content items, the value is an array of references to the parent elements of those marked-content sequences.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys.ParentTreeNextKey
member.summary: (Optional) An integer greater than any key in the parent tree, to be used as a key for the next entry added to the tree.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys.RoleMap
member.summary: (Optional) A dictionary that maps the names of structure types used in the document to their approximate equivalents in the set of standard structure types.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfStructureTreeRoot.Keys.ClassMap
member.summary: (Optional) A dictionary that maps name objects designating attribute classes to the corresponding attribute objects or arrays of attribute objects.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfTableAttributes.Keys.RowSpan
member.summary: (Optional; not inheritable) The number of rows in the enclosing table that are spanned by the cell. The cell expands by adding rows in the block-progression direction specified by the table’s WritingMode attribute. Default value: 1. This entry applies only to table cells that have structure types TH or TD or that are role mapped to structure types TH or TD.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Structure.PdfTableAttributes.Keys.ColSpan
member.summary: (Optional; not inheritable) The number of columns in the enclosing table that are spanned by the cell. The cell expands by adding columns in the inline-progression direction specified by the table’s WritingMode attribute. Default value: 1. This entry applies only to table cells that have structure types TH or TD or that are role mapped to structure types TH or TD.

member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPageDestinationType.FitH
member.summary: Display the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPageDestinationType.FitV
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPageDestinationType.FitR
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the rectangle within the window in the other dimension. A null value for any of the parameters may result in unpredictable behavior.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPageDestinationType.FitB
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPageDestinationType.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPageDestinationType.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPageLayout.TwoPageRight
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the right.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfTextStringEncoding
member.summary: Specifies how text strings are encoded. A text string is any text used outside of a page content stream, e.g. document information, outline text, annotation text etc.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfTextStringEncoding.PDFDocEncoding
member.summary: Specifies that hypertext uses PDF DocEncoding.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfTextStringEncoding.Unicode
member.summary: Specifies that hypertext uses Unicode encoding.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfUseFlateDecoderForJpegImages
member.summary: Specifies whether to compress JPEG images with the FlateDecode filter.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfUseFlateDecoderForJpegImages.Automatic
member.summary: PDFsharp will try FlateDecode and use it if it leads to a reduction in PDF file size. When FlateEncodeMode is set to BestCompression, this is more likely to reduce the file size, but it takes considerably more time to create the PDF file.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfUseFlateDecoderForJpegImages.Never
member.summary: PDFsharp will never use FlateDecode - files may be a few bytes larger, but file creation is faster.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfUseFlateDecoderForJpegImages.Always
member.summary: PDFsharp will always use FlateDecode, even if this leads to larger files; this option is meant for testing purposes only and should not be used for production code.

member.summary: Gets the length of the stream, i.e. the actual number of bytes in the stream.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Value
member.summary: Get or sets the bytes of the stream as they are, i.e. if one or more filters exist the bytes are not unfiltered.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.UnfilteredValue
member.summary: Gets the value of the stream unfiltered. The stream content is not modified by this operation.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.TryUnfilter
member.summary: Tries to unfilter the bytes of the stream. If the stream is filtered and PDFsharp knows the filter algorithm, the stream content is replaced by its unfiltered value and the function returns true. Otherwise, the content remains untouched and the function returns false. The function is useful for analyzing existing PDF files.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Zip
member.summary: Compresses the stream with the FlateDecode filter. If a filter is already defined, the function has no effect.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.ToString
member.summary: Returns the stream content as a raw string.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.Length
member.summary: (Required) The number of bytes from the beginning of the line following the keyword stream to the last byte just before the keyword endstream. (There may be an additional EOL marker, preceding endstream, that is not included in the count and is not logically part of the stream data.)

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.Filter
member.summary: (Optional) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the stream data found between the keywords stream and endstream, or an array of such names. Multiple filters should be specified in the order in which they are to be applied.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.DecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional) A parameter dictionary or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by Filter. If there is only one filter and that filter has parameters, DecodeParms must be set to the filter’s parameter dictionary unless all the filter’s parameters have their default values, in which case the DecodeParms entry may be omitted. If there are multiple filters and any of the filters has parameters set to nondefault values, DecodeParms must be an array with one entry for each filter: either the parameter dictionary for that filter, or the null object if that filter has no parameters (or if all of its parameters have their default values). If none of the filters have parameters, or if all their parameters have default values, the DecodeParms entry may be omitted.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.F
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The file containing the stream data. If this entry is present, the bytes between stream and endstream are ignored, the filters are specified by FFilter rather than Filter, and the filter parameters are specified by FDecodeParms rather than DecodeParms. However, the Length entry should still specify the number of those bytes. (Usually, there are no bytes and Length is 0.)

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.FFilter
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the data found in the stream’s external file, or an array of such names. The same rules apply as for Filter.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.FDecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A parameter dictionary, or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by FFilter. The same rules apply as for DecodeParms.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.DL
member.summary: Optional; PDF 1.5) A non-negative integer representing the number of bytes in the decoded (defiltered) stream. It can be used to determine, for example, whether enough disk space is available to write a stream to a file. This value should be considered a hint only; for some stream filters, it may not be possible to determine this value precisely.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDictionary.DebuggerDisplay
member.summary: Gets the DebuggerDisplayAttribute text.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument
member.summary: Represents a PDF document.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new PDF document in memory. To open an existing PDF file, use the PdfReader class.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new PDF document with the specified file name. The file is immediately created and kept locked until the document is closed. At that time the document is saved automatically. Do not call Save for documents created with this constructor, just call Close. To open an existing PDF file and import it, use the PdfReader class.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new PDF document using the specified stream. The stream won’t be used until the document is closed. At that time the document is saved automatically. Do not call Save for documents created with this constructor, just call Close. To open an existing PDF file, use the PdfReader class.

member.summary: Why we need XML documentation here?

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes all references to this document stored in other documents. This function should be called for documents you finished importing pages from. Calling Dispose is technically not necessary but useful for earlier reclaiming memory of documents you do not need anymore.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument.AddCharacters(PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont,System.String)
member.summary: Adds characters whose glyphs have to be embedded in the PDF file. By default, PDFsharp only embeds glyphs of a font that are used for drawing text on a page. With this function actually unused glyphs can be added. This is useful for PDF that can be modified or has text fields. So all characters that can be potentially used are available in the PDF document.
member.param: The font whose glyph should be added.
A string with all unicode characters that should be added.

member.summary: Gets or sets the flate encode mode. Besides the balanced default mode you can set modes for best compression (slower) or best speed (larger files).

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocumentOptions.EnableCcittCompressionForBilevelImages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to compress bilevel images using CCITT compression. With true, PDFsharp will try FlateDecode CCITT and will use the smallest one or a combination of both. With false, PDFsharp will always use FlateDecode only - files may be a few bytes larger, but file creation is faster.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocumentOptions.UseFlateDecoderForJpegImages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to compress JPEG images with the FlateDecode filter.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfNameTreeNode.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfNameTreeNode.Keys.Kids
member.summary: (Root and intermediate nodes only; required in intermediate nodes; present in the root node if and only if Names is not present) An array of indirect references to the immediate children of this node The children may be intermediate or leaf nodes.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfNameTreeNode.Keys.Names
member.summary: (Root and leaf nodes only; required in leaf nodes; present in the root node if and only if Kids is not present) An array of the form [key1 value1 key2 value2 … keyn valuen] where each keyi is a string and the corresponding valuei is the object associated with that key. The keys are sorted in lexical order, as described below.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfNameTreeNode.Keys.Limits
member.summary: (Intermediate and leaf nodes only; required) An array of two strings, specifying the (lexically) least and greatest keys included in the Names array of a leaf node or in the Namesarrays of any leaf nodes that are descendants of an intermediate node.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.summary: (Root and intermediate nodes only; required in intermediate nodes; present in the root node if and only if Nums is not present) An array of indirect references to the immediate children of this node. The children may be intermediate or leaf nodes.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfNumberTreeNode.Keys.Nums
member.summary: (Root and leaf nodes only; required in leaf nodes; present in the root node if and only if Kids is not present) An array of the form [key1 value1 key2 value2 … keyn valuen] where each keyi is an integer and the corresponding valuei is the object associated with that key. member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfNumberTreeNode.Keys.Limits
member.summary: (Intermediate and leaf nodes only; required) An array of two integers, specifying the (numerically) least and greatest keys included in the Nums array of a leaf node or in the Nums arrays of any leaf nodes that are descendants of an intermediate node.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be Outlines for an outline dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Title
member.summary: (Required) The text to be displayed on the screen for this item.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The parent of this item in the outline hierarchy. The parent of a top-level item is the outline dictionary itself.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Prev
member.summary: (Required for all but the first item at each level; must be an indirect reference) The previous item at this outline level.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Next
member.summary: (Required for all but the last item at each level; must be an indirect reference) The next item at this outline level.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.First
member.summary: (Required if the item has any descendants; must be an indirect reference) The first of this item’s immediate children in the outline hierarchy.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Last
member.summary: (Required if the item has any descendants; must be an indirect reference) The last of this item’s immediate children in the outline hierarchy.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Count
member.summary: (Required if the item has any descendants) If the item is open, the total number of its open descendants at all lower levels of the outline hierarchy. If the item is closed, a negative integer whose absolute value specifies how many descendants would appear if the item were reopened.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.Dest
member.summary: (Optional; not permitted if an A entry is present) The destination to be displayed when this item is activated.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.A
member.summary: (Optional; not permitted if a Dest entry is present) The action to be performed when this item is activated.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.SE
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; must be an indirect reference) The structure element to which the item refers. Note: The ability to associate an outline item with a structure element (such as the beginning of a chapter) is a PDF 1.3 feature. For backward compatibility with earlier PDF versions, such an item should also specify a destination (Dest) corresponding to an area of a page where the contents of the designated structure element are displayed.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.C
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) An array of three numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0, representing the components in the DeviceRGB color space of the color to be used for the outline entry’s text. Default value: [0.0 0.0 0.0].

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfOutline.Keys.F
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A set of flags specifying style characteristics for displaying the outline item’s text. Default value: 0.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage
member.summary: Represents a page in a PDF document.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new page. The page must be added to a document before it can be used. Depending on the IsMetric property of the current region the page size is set to A4 or Letter respectively. If this size is not appropriate it should be changed before any drawing operations are performed on the page.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.#ctor(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The document.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets a user defined object that contains arbitrary information associated with this PDF page. The tag is not used by PDFsharp.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Close
member.summary: Closes the page. A closed page cannot be modified anymore, and it is not possible to get an XGraphics object for a closed page. Closing a page is not required, but may save resources if the document has many pages.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the page is closed.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the PdfDocument this page belongs to.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the page. The default value PageOrientation.Portrait. If an imported page has a /Rotate value that matches the formula 90 + n * 180 the orientation is set to PageOrientation.Landscape.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets one of the predefined standard sizes like.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.TrimMargins
member.summary: Gets or sets the trim margins.

member.summary: Gets or sets the media box directly. XGraphics is not prepared to work with a media box with an origin other than (0,0).

member.summary: Gets or sets the crop box.

member.summary: Gets or sets the art box.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.TrimBox
member.summary: Gets or sets the trim box.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the page. If orientation is Landscape, this function applies to the width.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the page. If orientation is Landscape, this function applies to the height.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Rotate
member.summary: Gets or sets the /Rotate entry of the PDF page. The value is the number of degrees by which the page should be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value must be a multiple of 90. PDFsharp does not set this value, but for imported pages this value can be set and must be taken into account when adding graphic to such a page.

The destination page.

member.summary: Adds an internal document link.

The Named Destination’s name.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.AddDocumentLink(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfRectangle,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds an external document link.
member.param: The link area in default page coordinates.
The path to the target document.
The Named Destination’s name in the target document.
True, if the destination document shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.AddEmbeddedDocumentLink(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfRectangle,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds an embedded document link.
member.param: The link area in default page coordinates.

The path to the named destination through the embedded documents. The path is separated by '\' and the last segment is the name of the named destination. The other segments describe the route from the current (root or embedded) document to the embedded document holding the destination. ".." references to the parent, other strings refer to a child with this name in the EmbeddedFiles name dictionary.
True, if the destination document shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.AddEmbeddedDocumentLink(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfRectangle,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds an external embedded document link.
member.param: The link area in default page coordinates.
The path to the target document.

The path to the named destination through the embedded documents in the target document. The path is separated by '\' and the last segment is the name of the named destination. The other segments describe the route from the root document to the embedded document. Each segment name refers to a child with this name in the EmbeddedFiles name dictionary.
True, if the destination document shall be opened in a new window. If not set, the viewer application should behave in accordance with the current user preference.

member.summary: Inherit values from parent node.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Page for a page object.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The page tree node that is the immediate parent of this page object.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.LastModified
member.summary: (Required if PieceInfo is present; optional otherwise; PDF 1.3) The date and time when the page’s contents were most recently modified. If a page-piece dictionary (PieceInfo) is present, the modification date is used to ascertain which of the application data dictionaries that it contains correspond to the current content of the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.BleedBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the region to which the contents of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.TrimBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.ArtBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the extent of the page’s meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the page’s creator. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.BoxColorInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A box color information dictionary specifying the colors and other visual characteristics to be used in displaying guidelines on the screen for the various page boundaries. If this entry is absent, the application should use its own current default settings.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Contents
member.summary: (Optional) A content stream describing the contents of this page. If this entry is absent, the page is empty. The value may be either a single stream or an array of streams. If the value is an array, the effect is as if all of the streams in the array were concatenated, in order, to form a single stream. This allows PDF producers to create image objects and other resources as they occur, even though they interrupt the content stream. The division between streams may occur only at the boundaries between lexical tokens but is unrelated to the page’s logical content or organization. Applications that consume or produce PDF files are not required to preserve the existing structure of the Contents array.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Group
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A group attributes dictionary specifying the attributes of the page’s page group for use in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Thumb
member.summary: (Optional) A stream object defining the page’s thumbnail image.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.B
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; recommended if the page contains article beads) An array of indirect references to article beads appearing on the page. The beads are listed in the array in natural reading order.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Dur
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) The page’s display duration (also called its advance timing): the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page is displayed during presentations before the viewer application automatically advances to the next page. By default, the viewer does not advance automatically.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Trans
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A transition dictionary describing the transition effect to be used when displaying the page during presentations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Annots
member.summary: (Optional) An array of annotation dictionaries representing annotations associated with the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An additional-actions dictionary defining actions to be performed when the page is opened or closed.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.PieceInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A page-piece dictionary associated with the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.StructParents
member.summary: (Required if the page contains structural content items; PDF 1.3) The integer key of the page’s entry in the structural parent tree.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; indirect reference preferred) The digital identifier of the page’s parent Web Capture content set.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.PZ
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The page’s preferred zoom (magnification) factor: the factor by which it should be scaled to achieve the natural display magnification.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.SeparationInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A separation dictionary containing information needed to generate color separations for the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Tabs
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A name specifying the tab order to be used for annotations on the page. The possible values are R (row order), C (column order), and S (structure order).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.TemplateInstantiated
member.summary: (Required if this page was created from a named page object; PDF 1.5) The name of the originating page object.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.PresSteps
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A navigation node dictionary representing the first node on the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.UserUnit
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) A positive number giving the size of default user space units, in multiples of 1/72 inch. The range of supported values is implementation-dependent.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.VP
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) An array of viewport dictionaries specifying rectangular regions of the page.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys
member.summary: Predefined keys common to PdfPage and PdfPages.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.Resources
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A dictionary containing any resources required by the page. If the page requires no resources, the value of this entry should be an empty dictionary. Omitting the entry entirely indicates that the resources are to be inherited from an ancestor node in the page tree.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.MediaBox
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is intended to be displayed or printed.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.CropBox
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the visible region of default user space. When the page is displayed or printed, its contents are to be clipped (cropped) to this rectangle and then imposed on the output medium in some implementation defined manner. Default value: the value of MediaBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.Rotate
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The number of degrees by which the page should be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value must be a multiple of 90. Default value: 0.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritedValues
member.summary: Values inherited from a parent in the parent chain of a page tree.

member.summary: Imports an external page. The elements of the imported page are cloned and added to this document. Important: In contrast to PdfFormXObject adding an external page always make a deep copy of their transitive closure. member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: Represents the PDF document viewer preferences dictionary.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideToolbar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide the viewer application’s tool bars when the document is active.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideMenubar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide the viewer application’s menu bar when the document is active.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to position the document’s window in the center of the screen.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary. If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Direction
member.summary: The predominant reading order for text: LeftToRight or RightToLeft (including vertical writing systems, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean). This entry has no direct effect on the document’s contents or page numbering but can be used to determine the relative positioning of pages when displayed side by side or printed n-up. Default value: LeftToRight.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.HideToolbar
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s tool bars when the document is active. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.HideMenubar
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s menu bar when the document is active. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.HideWindowUI
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.FitWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.CenterWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to position the document’s window in the center of the screen. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A flag specifying whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary. If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: (Optional) The document’s page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode: UseNone Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible UseOutlines Document outline visible UseThumbs Thumbnail images visible UseOC Optional content group panel visible This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.Direction
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The predominant reading order for text: L2R Left to right R2L Right to left (including vertical writing systems, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) This entry has no direct effect on the document’s contents or page numbering but can be used to determine the relative positioning of pages when displayed side by side or printed n-up. Default value: L2R.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.ViewArea
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary representing the area of a page to be displayed when viewing the document on the screen. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries as described in Section 10.10.1, “Page Boundaries.” Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.ViewClip
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary to which the contents of a page are to be clipped when viewing the document on the screen. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries as described in Section 10.10.1, “Page Boundaries.” Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.PrintArea
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary representing the area of a page to be rendered when printing the document. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries as described in Section 10.10.1, “Page Boundaries.” Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.PrintClip
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary to which the contents of a page are to be clipped when printing the document. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries. Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.PrintScaling
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) The page scaling option to be selected when a print dialog is displayed for this document. Valid values are None, which indicates that the print dialog should reflect no page scaling, and AppDefault, which indicates that applications should use the current print scaling. If this entry has an unrecognized value, applications should use the current print scaling. Default value: AppDefault. Note: If the print dialog is suppressed and its parameters are provided directly by the application, the value of this entry should still be used.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.summary: Access to action information with fluent API.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Capabilities.Action.GlyphsToPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to be taken when trying to convert glyphs into a graphical path and this feature is currently not supported.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Capabilities.Action.PathOperations
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to be taken when a not implemented path operation was invoked. Currently, AddPie, AddClosedCurve, and AddPath are not implemented.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Capabilities.Compatibility
member.summary: Access to compatibility features with fluent API.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Capabilities.Compatibility.IgnoreErrorsOnDecryption
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that defines how cryptographic exceptions should be handled that occur while decrypting objects of an encrypted document. If false, occurring exceptions will be rethrown and PDFsharp will only open correctly encrypted documents. If true, occurring exceptions will be caught and only logged for information purposes. This way PDFsharp will be able to load documents with unencrypted contents that should be encrypted due to the settings of the file.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag
member.summary: PDF Block Level Element tags for Universal Accessibility.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.P
member.summary: (Paragraph) A low-level division of text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Paragraph
member.summary: A low-level division of text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.H
member.summary: (Heading) A label for a subdivision of a document’s content. It should be the first child of the division that it heads.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Heading
member.summary: A label for a subdivision of a document’s content. It should be the first child of the division that it heads.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.H1
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting. Obsolete: Use Heading1 etc. instead.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.H2
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting. Obsolete: Use Heading1 etc. instead.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.H3
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting. Obsolete: Use Heading1 etc. instead.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.H4
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting. Obsolete: Use Heading1 etc. instead.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.H5
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting. Obsolete: Use Heading1 etc. instead.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.H6
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting. Obsolete: Use Heading1 etc. instead.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Heading1
member.summary: Headings with specific level 1, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Heading2
member.summary: Headings with specific level 2, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Heading3
member.summary: Headings with specific level 3, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Heading4
member.summary: Headings with specific level 4, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Heading5
member.summary: Headings with specific level 5, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Heading6
member.summary: Headings with specific level 6, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.L
member.summary: (List) A sequence of items of like meaning and importance. Its immediate children should be an optional caption (structure type Caption).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.List
member.summary: A sequence of items of like meaning and importance. Its immediate children should be an optional caption (structure type Caption).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Lbl
member.summary: (Label) A name or number that distinguishes a given item from others in the same list or other group of like items. In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the term being defined; in a bulleted or numbered list, it contains the bullet character or the number of the list item and associated punctuation.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Label
member.summary: A name or number that distinguishes a given item from others in the same list or other group of like items. In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the term being defined; in a bulleted or numbered list, it contains the bullet character or the number of the list item and associated punctuation.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.LI
member.summary: (List item) An individual member of a list. Its children may be one or more labels, list bodies, or both (structure types Lbl or LBody; see below).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.ListItem
member.summary: An individual member of a list. Its children may be one or more labels, list bodies, or both (structure types Lbl or LBody; see below).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.LBody
member.summary: (List body) The descriptive content of a list item. In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the definition of the term. It can either contain the content directly or have other BLSEs, perhaps including nested lists, as children.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.ListBody
member.summary: The descriptive content of a list item. In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the definition of the term. It can either contain the content directly or have other BLSEs, perhaps including nested lists, as children.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.Table
member.summary: A two-dimensional layout of rectangular data cells, possibly having a complex substructure. It contains either one or more table rows (structure type TR) as children; or an optional table head (structure type THead) followed by one or more table body elements (structure type TBody) and an optional table footer (structure type TFoot). In addition, a table may have an optional caption (structure type Caption) as its first or last child.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TR
member.summary: (Table row) A row of headings or data in a table. It may contain table header cells and table data cells (structure types TH and TD).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TableRow
member.summary: A row of headings or data in a table. It may contain table header cells and table data cells (structure types TH and TD).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TH
member.summary: (Table header cell) A table cell containing header text describing one or more rows or columns of the table.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TableHeaderCell
member.summary: A table cell containing header text describing one or more rows or columns of the table.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TD
member.summary: (Table data cell) A table cell containing data that is part of the table’s content.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TableDataCell
member.summary: A table cell containing data that is part of the table’s content.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.THead
member.summary: (Table header row group; PDF 1.5) A group of rows that constitute the header of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the top of each table fragment (although there is only one THead element).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TableHeadRowGroup
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) A group of rows that constitute the header of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the top of each table fragment (although there is only one THead element).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TBody
member.summary: (Table body row group; PDF 1.5) A group of rows that constitute the main body portion of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, the body area may be broken apart on a row boundary. A table may have multiple TBody elements to allow for the drawing of a border or background for a set of rows.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TableBodyRowGroup
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) A group of rows that constitute the main body portion of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, the body area may be broken apart on a row boundary. A table may have multiple TBody elements to allow for the drawing of a border or background for a set of rows.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TFoot
member.summary: (Table footer row group; PDF 1.5) A group of rows that constitute the footer of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the bottom of each table fragment (although there is only one TFoot element.)

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfBlockLevelElementTag.TableFooterRowGroup
member.summary: (PDF 1.5) A group of rows that constitute the footer of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the bottom of each table fragment (although there is only one TFoot element.)

member.name: T:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag
member.summary: PDF Grouping Element tags for Universal Accessibility.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Document
member.summary: (Document) A complete document. This is the root element of any structure tree containing multiple parts or multiple articles.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Part
member.summary: (Part) A large-scale division of a document. This type of element is appropriate for grouping articles or sections.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Article
member.summary: (Article) A relatively self-contained body of text constituting a single narrative or exposition. Articles should be disjoint; that is, they should not contain other articles as constituent elements.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Art
member.summary: (Article) A relatively self-contained body of text constituting a single narrative or exposition. Articles should be disjoint; that is, they should not contain other articles as constituent elements.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Section
member.summary: (Section) A container for grouping related content elements. For example, a section might contain a heading, several introductory paragraphs, and two or more other sections nested within it as subsections.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Sect
member.summary: (Section) A container for grouping related content elements. For example, a section might contain a heading, several introductory paragraphs, and two or more other sections nested within it as subsections.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Division
member.summary: (Division) A generic block-level element or group of elements.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Div
member.summary: (Division) A generic block-level element or group of elements.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.BlockQuotation
member.summary: (Block quotation) A portion of text consisting of one or more paragraphs attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.BlockQuote
member.summary: (Block quotation) A portion of text consisting of one or more paragraphs attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Caption
member.summary: (Caption) A brief portion of text describing a table or figure.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.TableOfContents
member.summary: (Table of contents) A list made up of table of contents item entries (structure type TableOfContentsItem; see below) and/or other nested table of contents entries (TableOfContents). A TableOfContents entry that includes only TableOfContentsItem entries represents a flat hierarchy. A TableOfContents entry that includes other nested TableOfContents entries (and possibly TableOfContentsItem entries) represents a more complex hierarchy. Ideally, the hierarchy of a top level TableOfContents entry reflects the structure of the main body of the document. Note: Lists of figures and tables, as well as bibliographies, can be treated as tables of contents for purposes of the standard structure types.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.TOC
member.summary: (Table of contents) A list made up of table of contents item entries (structure type TableOfContentsItem; see below) and/or other nested table of contents entries (TableOfContents). A TableOfContents entry that includes only TableOfContentsItem entries represents a flat hierarchy. A TableOfContents entry that includes other nested TableOfContents entries (and possibly TableOfContentsItem entries) represents a more complex hierarchy. Ideally, the hierarchy of a top level TableOfContents entry reflects the structure of the main body of the document. Note: Lists of figures and tables, as well as bibliographies, can be treated as tables of contents for purposes of the standard structure types.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.TableOfContentsItem
member.summary: (Table of contents item) An individual member of a table of contents. This entry’s children can be any of the following structure types: Label A label. Reference A reference to the title and the page number. NonstructuralElement Non-structure elements for wrapping a leader artifact. Paragraph Descriptive text. TableOfContents Table of content elements for hierarchical tables of content, as described for the TableOfContents entry.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.TOCI
member.summary: (Table of contents item) An individual member of a table of contents. This entry’s children can be any of the following structure types: Label A label. Reference A reference to the title and the page number. NonstructuralElement Non-structure elements for wrapping a leader artifact. Paragraph Descriptive text. TableOfContents Table of content elements for hierarchical tables of content, as described for the TableOfContents entry.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Index
member.summary: (Index) A sequence of entries containing identifying text accompanied by reference elements (structure type Reference) that point out occurrences of the specified text in the main body of a document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.NonstructuralElement
member.summary: (Nonstructural element) A grouping element having no inherent structural significance; it serves solely for grouping purposes. This type of element differs from a division (structure type Division; see above) in that it is not interpreted or exported to other document formats; however, its descendants are to be processed normally.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.NonStruct
member.summary: (Nonstructural element) A grouping element having no inherent structural significance; it serves solely for grouping purposes. This type of element differs from a division (structure type Division; see above) in that it is not interpreted or exported to other document formats; however, its descendants are to be processed normally.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.PrivateElement
member.summary: (Private element) A grouping element containing private content belonging to the application producing it. The structural significance of this type of element is unspecified and is determined entirely by the producer application. Neither the Private element nor any of its descendants are to be interpreted or exported to other document formats.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfGroupingElementTag.Private
member.summary: (Private element) A grouping element containing private content belonging to the application producing it. The structural significance of this type of element is unspecified and is determined entirely by the producer application. Neither the Private element nor any of its descendants are to be interpreted or exported to other document formats.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfIllustrationElementTag
member.summary: PDF Illustration Element tags for Universal Accessibility.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfIllustrationElementTag.Figure
member.summary: (Figure) An item of graphical content. Its placement may be specified with the Placementlayout attribute.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfIllustrationElementTag.Formula
member.summary: (Formula) A mathematical formula.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfIllustrationElementTag.Form
member.summary: (Form) A widget annotation representing an interactive form field. If the element contains a Role attribute, it may contain content items that represent the value of the (non-interactive) form field. If the element omits a Role attribute, its only child is an object reference identifying the widget annotation. The annotations’ appearance stream defines the rendering of the form element.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag
member.summary: PDF Inline Level Element tags for Universal Accessibility.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Span
member.summary: (Span) A generic inline portion of text having no particular inherent characteristics. It can be used, for example, to delimit a range of text with a given set of styling attributes.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Quotation
member.summary: (Quotation) An inline portion of text attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Quote
member.summary: (Quotation) An inline portion of text attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Note
member.summary: (Note) An item of explanatory text, such as a footnote or an endnote, that is referred to from within the body of the document. It may have a label (structure type Lbl) as a child. The note may be included as a child of the structure element in the body text that refers to it, or it may be included elsewhere (such as in an endnotes section) and accessed by means of a reference (structure type Reference).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Reference
member.summary: (Reference) A citation to content elsewhere in the document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.BibliographyEntry
member.summary: (Bibliography entry) A reference identifying the external source of some cited content. It may contain a label (structure type Lbl) as a child.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.BibEntry
member.summary: (Bibliography entry) A reference identifying the external source of some cited content. It may contain a label (structure type Lbl) as a child.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Code
member.summary: (Code) A fragment of computer program text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Link
member.summary: (Link) An association between a portion of the ILSE’s content and a corresponding link annotation or annotations. Its children are one or more content items or child ILSEs and one or more object references identifying the associated link annotations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Annotation
member.summary: (Annotation; PDF 1.5) An association between a portion of the ILSE’s content and a corresponding PDF annotation. Annotation is used for all PDF annotations except link annotations and widget annotations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Annot
member.summary: (Annotation; PDF 1.5) An association between a portion of the ILSE’s content and a corresponding PDF annotation. Annot is used for all PDF annotations except link annotations and widget annotations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Ruby
member.summary: (Ruby; PDF 1.5) A side-note (annotation) written in a smaller text size and placed adjacent to the base text to which it refers. It is used in Japanese and Chinese to describe the pronunciation of unusual words or to describe such items as abbreviations and logos. A Rubyelement may also contain the RB, RT, and RP elements.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.UniversalAccessibility.PdfInlineLevelElementTag.Warichu
member.summary: (Warichu; PDF 1.5) A comment or annotation in a smaller text size and formatted onto two smaller lines within the height of the containing text line and placed following (inline) the base text to which it refers. It is used in Japanese for descriptive comments and for ruby annotation text that is too long to be aesthetically formatted as a ruby. A Warichu element may also contain the WT and WP elements.
